because  we have removed gperftool dependency from the source
so I think that we may need to update the doc also.
I can pick up this one, if still available :)

I take a snippet of this change and test it in git1.8, which looks good to me.
```
[root@a2d83421c3b6 abstract_data_type]# git --version
git version 1.8.3.1
[root@a2d83421c3b6 abstract_data_type]# committer_date=($(git log -1 --format="%ci" 2> /dev/null))
[root@a2d83421c3b6 abstract_data_type]# committer_date="${committer_date[0]}T${committer_date[1]}${committer_date[2]:0:3}:${committer_date[2]:3:2}"
[root@a2d83421c3b6 abstract_data_type]# echo $committer_date
2020-10-19T12:03:03-04:00
```

And it won't break git2.x after the change.
```
$ ./tools/get_brpc_revision.sh .
0.9.7\|fix_get_brpc_revision\|74db116c\|2021-08-17T21:28:24+02:00
```
But without gperftools, how can users do cpu/heap profiling? Do we remove this because of license issue?

yes, you remove it because of license issue, 
do you still remember it?

No I don't remember :) I can't find any context in the commit history too: https://github.com/apache/incubator-brpc/commits/master/LICENSE.

We still use those files, for example src/butil/gperftools_profiler.h, and their license is listed here https://github.com/apache/incubator-brpc/blob/master/LICENSE#L760, which is 3-clause BSD and it's apache compatible. 
There may be some misunderstandings here.
ok, maybe you are right, I will close it now.
